decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo between Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Nomads en-Kor to create a loop where you can draw your entire library and potentially win the game on the spot. The deck also includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Keen-Eyed Curator to help dig for these combo pieces and protect them with interaction like Force of Will. The mana base is carefully constructed to support both the combo and the deck's control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful combo pieces such as Omniscience and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Cunning Wish to provide flexibility and protection. With a focus on cheating big threats into play through cards like Show and Tell and LÃ³rien Revealed, the deck aims to create explosive plays and win the game before the opponent has a chance to react. The deck also includes various control elements like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to disrupt the opponent's plans.

This deck aims to quickly play a high number of spells to win the game in a single turn. By using cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual to generate mana, the deck can quickly cast a series of creatures and spells to trigger a game-winning combo. The key cards of the deck are Boggart Trawler, Poxwalkers, Undercity Informer, and Balustrade Spy, which work together to mill the entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes protection with Pact of Negation and disruption with Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize.

The deck focuses on quickly filling your graveyard with powerful creatures to reanimate them and overwhelm your opponent. It combines efficient ways to discard creatures like Entomb and Thoughtseize with powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo. The key strategy is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty or Murktide Regent to close out the game before your opponent can respond.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and resource denial. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, Smallpox, and Wasteland to control the board while generating value with cards like Urza's Saga and Life from the Loam. The deck also has win conditions in the form of Grist, the Hunger Tide and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Its strategy revolves around establishing board control, denying resources, and eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Storm mechanic to generate a high storm count and cast powerful spells like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony to win the game. The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy. By chaining together cards and generating a high storm count, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back into play for a strong early game advantage. It includes control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes blue card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the combo pieces quickly. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with key cards using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bringing powerful creatures back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent, or disrupt their strategy with cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to win the game quickly through efficient and explosive plays.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using them to generate card advantage and board presence. Emry, Lurker of the Loch serves as a recurring value engine, while Thought Monitor and Thoughtcast help dig for key pieces. Urza's Saga provides additional artifact sources and can tutor up powerful artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Lotus Petal. Force of Will offers protection and disruption against opposing strategies, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and tempo. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive threats and efficient card advantage.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to aggressively control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Surgical Extraction, while also putting pressure on them with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to quickly close out the game with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, while also utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm to dig for key combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes land disruption with Wasteland to further disrupt opponents' game plans.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill through the deck to get all the necessary combo pieces into the graveyard, then utilize Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle and win the game on the spot. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Pact of Negation while accelerating its game plan with cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal. The many ways to generate mana quickly and search for combo pieces make this deck a high-risk, high-reward strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 play.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the powerful combination of Show and Tell with high-impact creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty to cheat them into play. By disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to protect its combo pieces and ensure their successful resolution. Additionally, cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal provide mana acceleration to enable explosive starts. The inclusion of reanimation spells like Reanimate adds redundancy to the deck's strategy and allows for additional ways to cheat creatures into play.

This Legacy Combo - Show and Tell deck aims to cheat huge creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The deck also includes protection with Force of Will and disruption with Stock Up and Flusterstorm. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to speed up its game plan and can quickly overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures, making it a formidable threat in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this Control-Loam deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption, land destruction, and creature removal while utilizing Life from the Loam to continuously recycle resources from the graveyard. The deck also has a toolbox approach with cards like Pithing Needle and Nihil Spellbomb to handle specific threats. Additionally, Urza's Saga provides additional value by fetching artifact lands and key artifacts like Boseiju, Who Endures. The deck aims to grind out the opponent with attrition and resource denial, ultimately controlling the game until victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent provide card advantage and pressure on the opponent, while Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty serve as powerful reanimated threats. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and powerful creatures brought back from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on utilizing Cloudpost lands to ramp into powerful threats quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void. The main win condition revolves around assembling a powerful board presence with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thundertrap Trainer, while also controlling the game with cards like Stock Up and Sink into Stupor. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and disrupt their strategy, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of speed, control, and powerful combos.
